name: Certificate of Undergraduate Study in Search & Rescue Operations

Certificate of Undergraduate Study in Se: Certificate of Undergraduate Study in Search & Rescue Operations The Certificate of Undergraduate Study (CUGS) in Search & Rescue Operations affords students the opportunity to understand the multidisciplinary nature of search and rescue teams as a specialty area within the field of Emergency Management and prepare them to work in various positions within a search and rescue team. The CUGS will explore how various skills are used to assist in emergency operations as part of a coordinated first responder event to find/recover missing, lost, deceased persons. The courses represented in the CUGS offer an in-depth understanding of the science and methodology of search and rescue process.

To be awarded the CUGS in Search & Rescue Operations, students must complete all courses required for the CUGS in Search & Rescue Operations with at least a 2.0 average.
